oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hendersonville Grammar School
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Hendersonville Grammar School. The students are gathered around the flag pole.

One of them, Arthur Stark, was one of the three boys from Hendersonville killed during World War II. Hendersonville Grammar School was one of Hendersonville's earliest school buildings. Rosa Edwards was principal there in the late 1920s. By 1937, the building was called the Rosa Edwards Elementary School, which it remained until at least 1951.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Schools; Students; Teachers; Buildings; Flags; Flagpoles
